body:
While working on a solution for #6409 I found out that the banner and especially its close button needs an improvement.

After:
![grafik](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/640de8d1-c23a-4174-8af4-ac5eaff49520)


Changes proposed in this pull request:

- `<button>` instead of the `<a href="">`: semantically much better
- added a little bit accessibility with the ARIA information 
- added a `title="close"` attribute to the button
- each theme has now a mouse over feedback (background color change gives feedback)

How to test the feature manually:

1. green `ok/good` notification: go to a config page and click the save button
2. red `bad` notification: go to "manage users" and remove the `required` attribute of the username field. Click the save button
3. hover with the cursor over the close button: see the "close" title. See the background color change as feedback.

Pull request checklist:

- [x] clear commit messages
- [x] code manually tested

(more PRs will come for #6409)
The program predates `<button>` being widely supported. (It even predates IE 11, and even if it hadn't IE 10 would've still been around for a number of years.) :-)
